definitions: past participle of lay; having been placed or set down in a particular position
showing a calm, relaxed, and unhurried manner or style
examples: The foundation was laid before construction began
Fresh flowers were laid on the memorial site
He has a laid-back approach to management
The restaurant had a laid atmosphere with soft music

definitions: unable to walk normally due to injury or disability affecting the leg or foot
pathetically weak, unconvincing, or unsatisfactory as an excuse or explanation
examples: The horse went lame after the race
His lame leg made climbing stairs difficult
That's a pretty lame excuse for being late
The movie had a lame ending that disappointed viewers

definitions: expressed grief, sorrow, or regret about something that has happened or been lost
examples: The lamented professor was remembered by former students
His lamented departure left the team without leadership
The lamented loss of traditional crafts concerns historians
Critics discussed the lamented decline of public discourse

definitions: actively expressing grief, regret, or sorrow about unfortunate events or circumstances
examples: The lamenting crowd gathered at the memorial service
Her lamenting voice could be heard throughout the house
Lamenting investors watched their portfolios decline in value
The article took a lamenting tone about urban decay

definitions: owning substantial property or estates, especially as a source of income
having arrived at or come down to rest on a surface
examples: The landed gentry controlled much of the countryside
Landed families often passed estates through generations
The landed aircraft taxied to the terminal gate
Newly landed immigrants waited in the arrivals hall

definitions: not owning any land or property, especially in agricultural or rural contexts
examples: Landless farmers worked as laborers on others' estates
The landless peasants demanded agricultural reform from government
Many landless people migrated to cities seeking employment
Landless workers formed cooperatives to pool their resources

definitions: completely enclosed by land with no direct access to the sea or ocean
examples: Switzerland is a landlocked country in central Europe
Landlocked nations often negotiate port access with neighbors
The landlocked lake had no outlet to the sea
Their landlocked location made importing goods more expensive

definitions: having grounds that have been designed, arranged, and planted for aesthetic effect
examples: The landscaped gardens attracted many visitors each year
Their landscaped yard featured native plants and stone paths
The landscaped campus provided students with beautiful surroundings
Landscaped medians made the highway more visually appealing

definitions: displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion; pleasantly lazy and relaxed
examples: She gave a languid wave from her poolside chair
The cat stretched in a languid manner after napping
His languid movements suggested complete lack of urgency
The languid pace of life suited the tropical climate

definitions: ungracefully tall and thin, with long limbs that seem loosely connected
examples: The lanky teenager towered over his classmates awkwardly
His lanky frame made finding clothes that fit difficult
The basketball team recruited several lanky players this season
Her lanky build gave her an advantage in swimming

definitions: no longer valid or in effect due to expiration or failure to renew
examples: His lapsed insurance policy left him without coverage
The lapsed membership meant she couldn't access facilities
Their lapsed agreement required renegotiation of all terms
Lapsed Catholics sometimes return to church later in life

definitions: comparative form of large; exceeding something else in size, extent, or capacity
examples: We need a larger vehicle for our growing family
The larger portion went to the hungriest person
Larger companies often have more resources than startups
The larger implications of the decision became clear later

definitions: relating to or being in the first stage of an insect's life after hatching
examples: The larval stage of butterflies is the caterpillar phase
Larval mosquitoes develop in standing water before emerging
Scientists studied the larval forms of various marine species
The larval development period varies by temperature conditions

definitions: feeling or revealing an overt and often offensive sexual desire in behavior or expression
examples: His lascivious comments made everyone uncomfortable at work
The painting's lascivious imagery caused controversy when exhibited
She ignored the lascivious looks from strangers at bar
The novel's lascivious content led to censorship attempts

definitions: striking forcefully and repeatedly, especially describing rain, wind, or physical punishment
examples: Lashing rain made driving conditions dangerous last night
The lashing winds bent trees nearly to the ground
The ship endured lashing waves during the fierce storm
Lashing branches scratched against the windows all night

definitions: continuing or remaining in existence for a long time; durable and permanent
examples: Their lasting friendship survived decades of life changes
The treaty had a lasting impact on international relations
She wanted to make a lasting contribution to science
The accident left lasting damage to his knee joint

definitions: existing but not yet developed, manifest, or active; present in hidden form
examples: Her latent artistic talent emerged after taking classes
The disease remained latent for years before symptoms appeared
Latent heat is released when water vapor condenses
The latent conflict between departments eventually surfaced publicly

definitions: of, at, toward, or from the side or sides rather than front or back
examples: The lateral movement of the crab fascinated beach visitors
Lateral thinking helps solve problems from new angles
He made a lateral career move to another department
The building's lateral supports provide structural stability

definitions: superlative of late; most recent in time or newest in development
examples: Have you heard the latest news about the election
The latest fashion trends appeared on the runway
Their latest product features improved battery life significantly
Check the website for the latest updates and information

definitions: of or relating to latitude; running east to west parallel to the equator
examples: Latitudinal climate zones affect vegetation patterns across continents
The latitudinal lines on maps help locate specific places
Scientists studied latitudinal variations in species diversity patterns
Latitudinal temperature gradients influence global weather systems significantly

definitions: deserving praise and commendation for being admirable or worthy of respect
examples: Her laudable efforts to help homeless families inspired others
The company's laudable environmental policies set industry standards
His laudable goal of universal education gained widespread support
Their laudable commitment to transparency improved public trust

definitions: containing or expressing praise and commendation for someone or their achievements
examples: The laudatory reviews helped the book become a bestseller
His laudatory speech honored the retiring teacher's dedication
Critics wrote laudatory articles about the groundbreaking research
The laudatory tone of the biography pleased the subject

definitions: so ludicrous, unreasonable, or inappropriate as to be amusing rather than serious
examples: Their laughable attempt at deception fooled nobody present
The proposal's laughable budget estimates undermined its credibility
His laughable excuse for being late amused the teacher
The movie's laughable special effects ruined dramatic scenes

definitions: making the sounds and movements of laughter; expressing mirth or amusement
examples: The laughing children played happily in the sunshine
Her laughing eyes showed genuine joy at the surprise
Laughing gulls gathered along the beach searching for food
The laughing audience appreciated the comedian's clever jokes

definitions: honored with an award for outstanding creative or intellectual achievement
examples: The poet laureate reads at important national ceremonies
Nobel laureate scientists gathered for the annual conference
The laureate professor received recognition for groundbreaking research
She became the youngest laureate in the award's history

definitions: of a pale purple color like that of lavender flowers
examples: She wore a beautiful lavender dress to the wedding
The lavender walls created a calming atmosphere in bedroom
Lavender sheets complemented the room's soft color scheme
The artist mixed blue and red to create lavender

definitions: sumptuously rich, elaborate, or luxurious; very generous or extravagant in giving
examples: The lavish party featured ice sculptures and live music
Their lavish lifestyle required substantial income to maintain
She received lavish praise for her exceptional performance
The lavish decorations transformed the ballroom into a palace

definitions: conforming to, permitted by, or recognized as valid under the law
examples: The lawful owner of the property filed a claim
Police ensured all protests remained peaceful and lawful
Their lawful marriage was recognized in all fifty states
The company's lawful business practices earned customer trust

definitions: not governed by or obedient to laws; characterized by lack of civic order
examples: The lawless frontier town needed a strong sheriff
Lawless behavior during riots resulted in numerous arrests
Pirates created lawless communities on remote Caribbean islands
The lawless region became a haven for smugglers

definitions: not sufficiently strict, severe, or careful; relaxed about standards or procedures
examples: The teacher's lax discipline led to classroom chaos
Lax security measures allowed unauthorized access to building
Their lax attitude toward deadlines frustrated project managers
The company's lax enforcement of rules created safety hazards

definitions: tending to stimulate or facilitate evacuation of the bowels
examples: Prunes have natural laxative properties that aid digestion
The doctor prescribed a mild laxative for her constipation
Certain herbs produce laxative effects when consumed regularly
The laxative medication should be taken with plenty water

definitions: arranged in or consisting of multiple layers stacked upon one another
examples: Her layered haircut added volume and movement to style
The layered cake featured chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry
Layered clothing helps regulate body temperature in changing weather
The artist created depth using layered painting techniques

definitions: containing lead as an additive or component, especially in fuel or glass
examples: Leaded gasoline was phased out due to environmental concerns
The old house had leaded windows with decorative patterns
Leaded crystal glasses sparkled on the formal dining table
Scientists tested soil for leaded paint contamination near buildings

definitions: of a dull gray color like that of lead metal
slow, heavy, and laborious in movement or manner
examples: The leaden sky threatened rain throughout the afternoon
Pollution gave the river a leaden, lifeless appearance
His leaden footsteps showed his exhaustion after the hike
The conversation proceeded at a leaden pace without enthusiasm

definitions: having leaves of a specified kind or number; covered with foliage
examples: The broad-leafed plants thrived in tropical humidity
Four-leafed clovers are considered lucky when found naturally
The thick-leafed succulent stored water in desert conditions
Copper-leafed varieties added color to the garden design

definitions: having no leaves, either naturally or due to seasonal change or disease
examples: The leafless trees stood stark against the winter sky
Disease left the orchard leafless before autumn arrived
Leafless branches created dramatic silhouettes at sunset
The leafless cactus adapted perfectly to desert conditions

definitions: having many leaves or much foliage; characterized by trees and greenery
examples: They moved to a leafy suburb outside the city
The leafy vegetables provided essential nutrients in their diet
Leafy trees provided welcome shade during hot summer days
The restaurant's leafy courtyard offered a peaceful dining experience

definitions: allowing liquid or gas to enter or escape through holes or gaps
examples: The leaky roof needed immediate repair before rain season
A leaky faucet wasted gallons of water each day
Their leaky boat required constant bailing to stay afloat
The plumber fixed the leaky pipe under the sink

definitions: deviating from a vertical position; inclined or tilted to one side
examples: The leaning tower attracted tourists from around the world
Strong winds left the fence leaning dangerously to east
The leaning tree finally fell during the severe storm
Her leaning posture suggested fatigue after the long journey

definitions: having acquired much knowledge through study; showing profound knowledge or scholarship
examples: The learned professor published numerous articles on ancient history
Her learned analysis impressed the academic conference attendees
Learned societies promote research and scholarly discussion worldwide
The learned judge cited precedents from three centuries

definitions: held or used under a lease agreement for specified time and payment
examples: Their leased car required full insurance coverage by contract
The leased equipment saved the startup significant capital
Leased office space provided flexibility for the growing company
The farmer worked leased land to expand crop production

definitions: having a tough, flexible texture resembling leather; hardened and weather-beaten
examples: Years of sun exposure gave him leathery, weathered skin
The plant's leathery leaves resisted drought conditions effectively
Her leathery hands showed decades of hard farm work
The steak's leathery texture resulted from overcooking

definitions: furnished with or characterized by leaves of a particular type or number
examples: The five-leaved plant was easy to identify in field
Broad-leaved trees dominated the temperate forest ecosystem
The newly leaved branches signaled spring's arrival in garden
Three-leaved poison ivy caused severe skin reactions

definitions: made light and porous by fermentation with yeast or similar agent
examples: Leavened bread has a lighter texture than flatbread varieties
The bakery specialized in traditionally leavened sourdough loaves
Properly leavened dough doubled in size before baking
The leavened cake rose beautifully in the oven

definitions: having or showing excessive or offensive sexual desire; lustful in a crude way
examples: His lecherous behavior at work led to harassment complaints
The lecherous old man made inappropriate comments to waitresses
She avoided the bar's lecherous patrons who wouldn't leave her alone
The novel's lecherous villain pursued the innocent heroine relentlessly

definitions: situated on or toward the side sheltered from the wind; protected position
examples: Sailors anchored in the lee of the island for protection
The lee side of the mountain received less rainfall
They pitched camp on the lee slope away from prevailing winds
Birds gathered on the lee side of the building during storms

definitions: on or toward the side away from the wind; the downwind side
examples: The leeward coast had calmer waters than the windward side
Ships approached from the leeward direction for easier docking
The leeward islands enjoyed protection from hurricane winds
Vegetation grew more abundantly on the leeward mountain slopes

definitions: having liberal, socialist, or radical political views; supporting the left wing
examples: The leftist candidate promoted universal healthcare and education
Leftist parties gained seats in the recent parliamentary elections
His leftist views clashed with the conservative board members
The leftist newspaper criticized corporate tax breaks consistently

definitions: situated at or extending to the position farthest to the left side
examples: Click the leftmost button to return to the homepage
The leftmost lane is reserved for high-occupancy vehicles
Start reading from the leftmost column of the spreadsheet
The leftmost digit determines the number's magnitude

definitions: remaining after the rest has been used, consumed, or dealt with
examples: She made soup from leftover vegetables in the refrigerator
Leftover paint was donated to the community art center
The leftover fabric became material for a quilting project
They distributed leftover food to homeless shelters after events
